00047 RoutingTable::RoutingTable()
00048 {
00049 }
00050 
00051 RoutingTable::~RoutingTable()
00052 {
00053     for (unsigned int i=0; i<routes.size(); i++)
00054         delete routes[i];
00055     for (unsigned int i=0; i<multicastRoutes.size(); i++)
00056         delete multicastRoutes[i];
00057 }
00058 
00059 void RoutingTable::initialize(int stage)
00060 {
00061     if (stage==0)
00062     {
00063         // get a pointer to the NotificationBoard module and IInterfaceTable
00064         nb = NotificationBoardAccess().get();
00065         ift = InterfaceTableAccess().get();
00066 
00067         IPForward = par("IPForward").boolValue();
00068 
00069         nb->subscribe(this, NF_INTERFACE_CREATED);
00070         nb->subscribe(this, NF_INTERFACE_DELETED);
00071         nb->subscribe(this, NF_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGED);
00072         nb->subscribe(this, NF_INTERFACE_CONFIG_CHANGED);
00073         nb->subscribe(this, NF_INTERFACE_IPv4CONFIG_CHANGED);
00074 
00075         WATCH_PTRVECTOR(routes);
00076         WATCH_PTRVECTOR(multicastRoutes);
00077         WATCH(IPForward);
00078         WATCH(routerId);
00079     }
00080     else if (stage==1)
00081     {
00082         // L2 modules register themselves in stage 0, so we can only configure
00083         // the interfaces in stage 1.
00084         const char *filename = par("routingFile");
00085 
00086         // At this point, all L2 modules have registered themselves (added their
00087         // interface entries). Create the per-interface IPv4 data structures.
00088         IInterfaceTable *interfaceTable = InterfaceTableAccess().get();
00089         for (int i=0; i<interfaceTable->getNumInterfaces(); ++i)
00090             configureInterfaceForIPv4(interfaceTable->getInterface(i));
00091         configureLoopbackForIPv4();
00092 
00093         // read routing table file (and interface configuration)
00094         RoutingTableParser parser(ift, this);
00095         if (*filename && parser.readRoutingTableFromFile(filename)==-1)
00096             error("Error reading routing table file %s", filename);
00097 
00098         // set routerId if param is not "" (==no routerId) or "auto" (in which case we'll
00099         // do it later in stage 3, after network configurators configured the interfaces)
00100         const char *routerIdStr = par("routerId").stringValue();
00101         if (strcmp(routerIdStr, "") && strcmp(routerIdStr, "auto"))
00102             routerId = IPAddress(routerIdStr);
00103     }
00104     else if (stage==3)
00105     {
00106         // routerID selection must be after stage==2 when network autoconfiguration
00107         // assigns interface addresses
00108         configureRouterId();
00109 
00110         // we don't use notifications during initialize(), so we do it manually.
00111         // Should be in stage=3 because autoconfigurator runs in stage=2.
00112         updateNetmaskRoutes();
00113 
00114         //printRoutingTable();
00115     }
00116 }
00117 
00118 void RoutingTable::configureRouterId()
00119 {
00120     if (routerId.isUnspecified())  // not yet configured
00121     {
00122         const char *routerIdStr = par("routerId").stringValue();
00123         if (!strcmp(routerIdStr, "auto"))  // non-"auto" cases already handled in stage 1
00124         {
00125             // choose highest interface address as routerId
00126             for (int i=0; i<ift->getNumInterfaces(); ++i)
00127             {
00128                 InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterface(i);
00129                 if (!ie->isLoopback() && ie->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress().getInt() > routerId.getInt())
00130                     routerId = ie->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress();
00131             }
00132         }
00133     }
00134     else // already configured
00135     {
00136         // if there is no interface with routerId yet, assign it to the loopback address;
00137         // TODO find out if this is a good practice, in which situations it is useful etc.
00138         if (getInterfaceByAddress(routerId)==NULL)
00139         {
00140             InterfaceEntry *lo0 = ift->getFirstLoopbackInterface();
00141             lo0->ipv4Data()->setIPAddress(routerId);
00142             lo0->ipv4Data()->setNetmask(IPAddress::ALLONES_ADDRESS);
00143         }
00144     }
00145 }
00146 
00147 void RoutingTable::updateDisplayString()
00148 {
00149     if (!ev.isGUI())
00150         return;
00151 
00152     char buf[80];
00153     if (routerId.isUnspecified())
00154         sprintf(buf, "%d+%d routes", routes.size(), multicastRoutes.size());
00155     else
00156         sprintf(buf, "routerId: %s\n%d+%d routes", routerId.str().c_str(), routes.size(), multicastRoutes.size());
00157     getDisplayString().setTagArg("t",0,buf);
00158 }

00160 void RoutingTable::handleMessage(cMessage *msg)
00161 {
00162     opp_error("This module doesn't process messages");
00163 }
00164 
00165 void RoutingTable::receiveChangeNotification(int category, const cPolymorphic *details)
00166 {
00167     if (simulation.getContextType()==CTX_INITIALIZE)
00168         return;  // ignore notifications during initialize
00169 
00170     Enter_Method_Silent();
00171     printNotificationBanner(category, details);
00172 
00173     if (category==NF_INTERFACE_CREATED)
00174     {
00175         // add netmask route for the new interface
00176         updateNetmaskRoutes();
00177     }
00178     else if (category==NF_INTERFACE_DELETED)
00179     {
00180         // remove all routes that point to that interface
00181         InterfaceEntry *entry = check_and_cast<InterfaceEntry*>(details);
00182         deleteInterfaceRoutes(entry);
00183     }
00184     else if (category==NF_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGED)
00185     {
00186         invalidateCache();
00187     }
00188     else if (category==NF_INTERFACE_CONFIG_CHANGED)
00189     {
00190         invalidateCache();
00191     }
00192     else if (category==NF_INTERFACE_IPv4CONFIG_CHANGED)
00193     {
00194         // if anything IPv4-related changes in the interfaces, interface netmask
00195         // based routes have to be re-built.
00196         updateNetmaskRoutes();
00197     }
00198 }
00199 
00200 void RoutingTable::deleteInterfaceRoutes(InterfaceEntry *entry)
00201 {
00202     RouteVector::iterator it = routes.begin();
00203     while (it != routes.end())
00204     {
00205         IPRoute *route = *it;
00206         if (route->getInterface() == entry)
00207         {
00208             deleteRoute(route);
00209             it = routes.begin();  // iterator became invalid -- start over
00210         }
00211         else
00212         {
00213             ++it;
00214         }
00215     }
00216 }
00217 
00218 void RoutingTable::invalidateCache()
00219 {
00220     routingCache.clear();
00221     localAddresses.clear();
00222 }

00224 void RoutingTable::printRoutingTable() const
00225 {
00226     EV << "-- Routing table --\n";
00227     ev.printf("%-16s %-16s %-16s %-3s %s\n",
00228               "Destination", "Gateway", "Netmask", "Iface");
00229 
00230     for (int i=0; i<getNumRoutes(); i++)
00231         EV << getRoute(i)->detailedInfo() << "\n";
00232     EV << "\n";
00233 }

00235 std::vector<IPAddress> RoutingTable::gatherAddresses() const
00236 {
00237     std::vector<IPAddress> addressvector;
00238 
00239     for (int i=0; i<ift->getNumInterfaces(); ++i)
00240         addressvector.push_back(ift->getInterface(i)->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress());
00241     return addressvector;
00242 }

00246 void RoutingTable::configureInterfaceForIPv4(InterfaceEntry *ie)
00247 {
00248     IPv4InterfaceData *d = new IPv4InterfaceData();
00249     ie->setIPv4Data(d);
00250 
00251     // metric: some hints: OSPF cost (2e9/bps value), MS KB article Q299540, ...
00252     d->setMetric((int)ceil(2e9/ie->getDatarate())); // use OSPF cost as default
00253 }
00254 
00255 InterfaceEntry *RoutingTable::getInterfaceByAddress(const IPAddress& addr) const
00256 {
00257     Enter_Method("getInterfaceByAddress(%u.%u.%u.%u)", addr.getDByte(0), addr.getDByte(1), addr.getDByte(2), addr.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here
00258 
00259     if (addr.isUnspecified())
00260         return NULL;
00261     for (int i=0; i<ift->getNumInterfaces(); ++i)
00262     {
00263         InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterface(i);
00264         if (ie->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress()==addr)
00265             return ie;
00266     }
00267     return NULL;
00268 }
00269 
00270 
00271 void RoutingTable::configureLoopbackForIPv4()
00272 {
00273     InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getFirstLoopbackInterface();
00274 
00275     // add IPv4 info. Set 127.0.0.1/8 as address by default --
00276     // we may reconfigure later it to be the routerId
00277     IPv4InterfaceData *d = new IPv4InterfaceData();
00278     d->setIPAddress(IPAddress::LOOPBACK_ADDRESS);
00279     d->setNetmask(IPAddress::LOOPBACK_NETMASK);
00280     d->setMetric(1);
00281     ie->setIPv4Data(d);
00282 }

00286 bool RoutingTable::isLocalAddress(const IPAddress& dest) const
00287 {
00288     Enter_Method("isLocalAddress(%u.%u.%u.%u)", dest.getDByte(0), dest.getDByte(1), dest.getDByte(2), dest.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here
00289 
00290     if (localAddresses.empty())
00291     {
00292         // collect interface addresses if not yet done
00293         for (int i=0; i<ift->getNumInterfaces(); i++)
00294         {
00295             IPAddress interfaceAddr = ift->getInterface(i)->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress();
00296             localAddresses.insert(interfaceAddr);
00297         }
00298     }
00299 
00300     AddressSet::iterator it = localAddresses.find(dest);
00301     return it!=localAddresses.end();
00302 }
00303 
00304 bool RoutingTable::isLocalMulticastAddress(const IPAddress& dest) const
00305 {
00306     Enter_Method("isLocalMulticastAddress(%u.%u.%u.%u)", dest.getDByte(0), dest.getDByte(1), dest.getDByte(2), dest.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here
00307 
00308     for (int i=0; i<ift->getNumInterfaces(); i++)
00309     {
00310         InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterface(i);
00311         if (ie->ipv4Data()->isMemberOfMulticastGroup(dest))
00312             return true;
00313     }
00314     return false;
00315 }
00316 
00317 
00318 const IPRoute *RoutingTable::findBestMatchingRoute(const IPAddress& dest) const
00319 {
00320     Enter_Method("findBestMatchingRoute(%u.%u.%u.%u)", dest.getDByte(0), dest.getDByte(1), dest.getDByte(2), dest.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here
00321 
00322     RoutingCache::iterator it = routingCache.find(dest);
00323     if (it != routingCache.end())
00324         return it->second;
00325 
00326     // find best match (one with longest prefix)
00327     // default route has zero prefix length, so (if exists) it'll be selected as last resort
00328     const IPRoute *bestRoute = NULL;
00329     uint32 longestNetmask = 0;
00330     for (RouteVector::const_iterator i=routes.begin(); i!=routes.end(); ++i)
00331     {
00332         const IPRoute *e = *i;
00333         if (IPAddress::maskedAddrAreEqual(dest, e->getHost(), e->getNetmask()) &&  // match
00334             (!bestRoute || e->getNetmask().getInt() > longestNetmask))  // longest so far
00335         {
00336             bestRoute = e;
00337             longestNetmask = e->getNetmask().getInt();
00338         }
00339     }
00340     routingCache[dest] = bestRoute;
00341     return bestRoute;
00342 }
00343 
00344 InterfaceEntry *RoutingTable::getInterfaceForDestAddr(const IPAddress& dest) const
00345 {
00346     Enter_Method("getInterfaceForDestAddr(%u.%u.%u.%u)", dest.getDByte(0), dest.getDByte(1), dest.getDByte(2), dest.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here
00347 
00348     const IPRoute *e = findBestMatchingRoute(dest);
00349     return e ? e->getInterface() : NULL;
00350 }
00351 
00352 IPAddress RoutingTable::getGatewayForDestAddr(const IPAddress& dest) const
00353 {
00354     Enter_Method("getGatewayForDestAddr(%u.%u.%u.%u)", dest.getDByte(0), dest.getDByte(1), dest.getDByte(2), dest.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here
00355 
00356     const IPRoute *e = findBestMatchingRoute(dest);
00357     return e ? e->getGateway() : IPAddress();
00358 }

00360 
00361 MulticastRoutes RoutingTable::getMulticastRoutesFor(const IPAddress& dest) const
00362 {
00363     Enter_Method("getMulticastRoutesFor(%u.%u.%u.%u)", dest.getDByte(0), dest.getDByte(1), dest.getDByte(2), dest.getDByte(3)); // note: str().c_str() too slow here here
00364 
00365     MulticastRoutes res;
00366     res.reserve(16);
00367     for (RouteVector::const_iterator i=multicastRoutes.begin(); i!=multicastRoutes.end(); ++i)
00368     {
00369         const IPRoute *e = *i;
00370         if (IPAddress::maskedAddrAreEqual(dest, e->getHost(), e->getNetmask()))
00371         {
00372             MulticastRoute r;
00373             r.interf = e->getInterface();
00374             r.gateway = e->getGateway();
00375             res.push_back(r);
00376         }
00377     }
00378     return res;
00379 }

00381 
00382 int RoutingTable::getNumRoutes() const
00383 {
00384     return routes.size()+multicastRoutes.size();
00385 }
00386 
00387 const IPRoute *RoutingTable::getRoute(int k) const
00388 {
00389     if (k < (int)routes.size())
00390         return routes[k];
00391     k -= routes.size();
00392     if (k < (int)multicastRoutes.size())
00393         return multicastRoutes[k];
00394     return NULL;
00395 }
00396 
00397 const IPRoute *RoutingTable::getDefaultRoute() const
00398 {
00399     int n = (int)routes.size();
00400     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00401         if (routes[i]->getNetmask().isUnspecified())
00402             return routes[i];
00403     return NULL;
00404 }
00405 
00406 const IPRoute *RoutingTable::findRoute(const IPAddress& target, const IPAddress& netmask,
00407     const IPAddress& gw, int metric, const char *dev) const
00408 {
00409     int n = getNumRoutes();
00410     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00411         if (routeMatches(getRoute(i), target, netmask, gw, metric, dev))
00412             return getRoute(i);
00413     return NULL;
00414 }
00415 
00416 void RoutingTable::addRoute(const IPRoute *entry)
00417 {
00418     Enter_Method("addRoute(...)");
00419 
00420     // check for null address and default route
00421     if (entry->getHost().isUnspecified() != entry->getNetmask().isUnspecified())
00422         error("addRoute(): to add a default route, set both host and netmask to zero");
00423 
00424     if (entry->getHost().doAnd(entry->getNetmask().isUnspecified()).getInt() != 0)
00425         error("addRoute(): suspicious route: host %s has 1-bits outside netmask %s",
00426               entry->getHost().str().c_str(), entry->getNetmask().str().c_str());
00427 
00428     // check that the interface exists
00429     if (!entry->getInterface())
00430         error("addRoute(): interface cannot be NULL");
00431 
00432     // if this is a default route, remove old default route (we're replacing it)
00433     if (entry->getNetmask().isUnspecified() && getDefaultRoute()!=NULL)
00434         deleteRoute(getDefaultRoute());
00435 
00436     // add to tables
00437     if (!entry->getHost().isMulticast())
00438         routes.push_back(const_cast<IPRoute*>(entry));
00439     else
00440         multicastRoutes.push_back(const_cast<IPRoute*>(entry));
00441 
00442     invalidateCache();
00443     updateDisplayString();
00444 
00445     nb->fireChangeNotification(NF_IPv4_ROUTE_ADDED, entry);
00446 }
00447 
00448 
00449 bool RoutingTable::deleteRoute(const IPRoute *entry)
00450 {
00451     Enter_Method("deleteRoute(...)");
00452 
00453     RouteVector::iterator i = std::find(routes.begin(), routes.end(), entry);
00454     if (i!=routes.end())
00455     {
00456         nb->fireChangeNotification(NF_IPv4_ROUTE_DELETED, entry); // rather: going to be deleted
00457         routes.erase(i);
00458         delete entry;
00459         invalidateCache();
00460         updateDisplayString();
00461         return true;
00462     }
00463     i = std::find(multicastRoutes.begin(), multicastRoutes.end(), entry);
00464     if (i!=multicastRoutes.end())
00465     {
00466         nb->fireChangeNotification(NF_IPv4_ROUTE_DELETED, entry); // rather: going to be deleted
00467         multicastRoutes.erase(i);
00468         delete entry;
00469         invalidateCache();
00470         updateDisplayString();
00471         return true;
00472     }
00473     return false;
00474 }
00475 
00476 
00477 bool RoutingTable::routeMatches(const IPRoute *entry,
00478     const IPAddress& target, const IPAddress& nmask,
00479     const IPAddress& gw, int metric, const char *dev) const
00480 {
00481     if (!target.isUnspecified() && !target.equals(entry->getHost()))
00482         return false;
00483     if (!nmask.isUnspecified() && !nmask.equals(entry->getNetmask()))
00484         return false;
00485     if (!gw.isUnspecified() && !gw.equals(entry->getGateway()))
00486         return false;
00487     if (metric && metric!=entry->getMetric())
00488         return false;
00489     if (dev && strcmp(dev, entry->getInterfaceName()))
00490         return false;
00491 
00492     return true;
00493 }
00494 
00495 void RoutingTable::updateNetmaskRoutes()
00496 {
00497     // first, delete all routes with src=IFACENETMASK
00498     for (unsigned int k=0; k<routes.size(); k++)
00499         if (routes[k]->getSource()==IPRoute::IFACENETMASK)
00500             routes.erase(routes.begin()+(k--));  // '--' is necessary because indices shift down
00501 
00502     // then re-add them, according to actual interface configuration
00503     for (int i=0; i<ift->getNumInterfaces(); i++)
00504     {
00505         InterfaceEntry *ie = ift->getInterface(i);
00506         if (ie->ipv4Data()->getNetmask()!=IPAddress::ALLONES_ADDRESS)
00507         {
00508             IPRoute *route = new IPRoute();
00509             route->setType(IPRoute::DIRECT);
00510             route->setSource(IPRoute::IFACENETMASK);
00511             route->setHost(ie->ipv4Data()->getIPAddress());
00512             route->setNetmask(ie->ipv4Data()->getNetmask());
00513             route->setGateway(IPAddress());
00514             route->setMetric(ie->ipv4Data()->getMetric());
00515             route->setInterface(ie);
00516             routes.push_back(route);
00517         }
00518     }
00519 
00520     invalidateCache();
00521     updateDisplayString();
00522 }
